repnme.cdata!:
India - Tamil Nadu Water Resources
            Consolidation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; project sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; Bank
            performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. The lessons the project provided related to
            the effectiveness of a separate component for land
            acquisition and economic rehabilitation in economically
            rehabilitating project affected persons; the contribution of
            an extended policy dialogue and detailed preparation to
            project implementation; the need to continue a
            multi-disciplinary approach to agricultural development
            including flexible investment in agricultural services,
            government extension services, and marketing networks. A
            focus should be put on more efficient procurement
            organization and procedures, as well as training in them;
            reconsidering the efficacy of imposing less relevant and
            difficult to enforce covenants; the need to involve
            beneficiaries in planning, implementation, and monitoring to
            improve transparency; engaging more experienced
            nongovernmental organizations capable of training less
            experienced NGOs; recognizing the role of water user
            associations as change agents, especially those involving
            women farmers; the need to contract reputed firms/make
            quality-based selection of firms for software development;
            the importance of drafting more detailed terms of reference
            for twinning consultancies; and finally, the need to
            consistently focus on policy issues, institutional
            restructuring, and cost recovery throughout project implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
India - Tamil Nadu Water Resources
            Consolidation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Tamil Nadu Water Resources
            Consolidation Project will be a sector investment loan
            financing an agreed state-wide program to improve the
            productivity and sustainability of Tamil Nadu's
            irrigation sector, to introduce multi-sectoral water
            planning, to integrate farmers in irrigation management, and
            to strengthen the state's institutional and technical
            capacity in water development, management and planning, The
            project will be implemented over seven years. Project
            components will be: (a) system improvement and farmer
            turnover; (b) scheme completions; (c) water planning,
            environmental management and research; (d) institutional
            strengthening; and (e) land acquisition and economic rehabilitation.

display_title.display_title:
India - Tamil Nadu Water
            Resources Consolidation Project (Vol. 2) : Annexes

repnme.cdata!:
India - Tamil Nadu Water Resources
            Consolidation Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The Tamil Nadu Water Resources
            Consolidation Project (WRCP) will cover the entire state. It
            aims to introduce a more rational and comprehensive approach
            to water resources planning and management which will
            prevent conflicts over water resource allocation and
            environmental degradation; improve the efficiency of water
            use for irrigation through rehabilitation, modernization,
            and improved maintenance so that increasing industrial and
            domestic demands can be met; and to improve the long-term
            sustainability of irrigation systems through enhanced farmer
            participation in operation and maintenance.  The project
            includes three major components: 1) modernization and
            rehabilitation of existing irrigation sub-projects; 2)
            completion of on-going irrigation works on a number of minor
            irrigation schemes; and 3) institutional strengthening,
            training, and special studies aimed at bringing about a
            radical change in the procedures for planning and managing
            water resource use in Tamil Nadu.

docna.cdata!:
India - Tamil Nadu Water Resources
            Consolidation Project : environmental assessment

display_title.display_title:
India - Tamil Nadu Water
            Resources Consolidation Project : environmental assessment
